title: How to Draw a Cartoon Baby Chick

steps.headline: Draw a circle for the head.
Draw another circle about as big as the head or smaller in size.
steps.description: Attach it to the circle you have already drawn, in the same manner as joining a snowman. This will form the body. It might look like an eight or two circles on top of each other.

steps.headline: Draw two ovals for the baby chick's eyes.
steps.description: They might look like two zeros: 00. Draw a circle inside each oval and color the rest in black. The inner oval is to make it appear as if light is shining on the baby chick's eyes.

steps.headline: Make a triangle for the beak.
steps.description: You can draw two little dots for nostrils if you want.

steps.headline: Draw feet.
steps.description: They will look like triangles with the point cut off. Attach these to the bottom of the baby chick.

steps.headline: Draw the baby chick's wings.
steps.description: They look sort of like half a U attached to the sides of him. They point inward. You can also make the wings appear like this: [> <], like sideways Vs.

text: Draw a circle for the head.  Draw another circle about as big as the head or smaller in size. Attach it to the circle you have already drawn, in the same manner as joining a snowman. This will form the body. It might look like an eight or two circles on top of each other. Draw two ovals for the baby chick's eyes. They might look like two zeros: 00. Draw a circle inside each oval and color the rest in black. The inner oval is to make it appear as if light is shining on the baby chick's eyes. Make a triangle for the beak. You can draw two little dots for nostrils if you want. Draw feet. They will look like triangles with the point cut off. Attach these to the bottom of the baby chick. Draw the baby chick's wings. They look sort of like half a U attached to the sides of him. They point inward. You can also make the wings appear like this: [> <], like sideways Vs. Finished.
